competitors.name: Absolute Thai
competitors.description: Modern take on Thai cuisine, uses fresh, locally grown mangoes.

competitors.name: Rama V
competitors.description: Refined dining experience with an emphasis on flavor and texture.

competitors.name: My Elephant
competitors.description: Popular choice for Thai food lovers in KL.

competitors.name: Baan 26
competitors.description: A well-regarded Thai restaurant in the city.

competitors.name: Jatujak Bangkok Street Food
competitors.description: Praised for its authentic Thai street food, and their mango sticky rice is a must-try. It's served on a pandan leaf with a large, juicy mango.

competitors.name: Thai Moment, Desa Setapak
competitors.description: Offers a simple yet delicious mango sticky rice made with fresh ingredients.

competitors.name: Malai Thai Cuisine
competitors.description: A great option for those craving authentic Thai flavors.

competitors.name: La Moon Thai Restaurant
competitors.description: Another excellent choice for traditional Thai food.

competitors.name: Thai Luck Thai Cuisine
competitors.description: This restaurant serves a simple but satisfying mango sticky rice that tastes like a 'tropical vacation.'

competitors.name: Yellow Thai Food
competitors.description: This food truck offers a quick and convenient mango sticky rice fix. Their version is infused with pandan flavor.

competitors.name: Rosdet Tomyam
competitors.description: A hidden gem on the outskirts of the city center, this spot serves affordable and delicious Thai-Malay fusion dishes, including a mango sticky rice with both plain and pandan-infused sticky rice.

competitors.name: Jalan Alor Night Market
competitors.description: For a classic street food experience, you can find vendors selling mango sticky rice at this bustling night market.
